blog.name: marvelzombiespromos
blog.title: Marvel Zombies Promos
blog.description:
This is the promo page for Marvel Zombies RP. For more information, please visit our main page.

The characters advertised are not an exclusive list, rather they are a short list of suggestions. Our intention is to maintain a rotor of characters from a variety of backgrounds. Please feel free to apply outside of the characters posted here.

summary: Marvel Zombies RP Wanted Connection: Miles Morales Requested by: Peter Parker Telephone networks have failed, the internet is...
caption:
Marvel Zombies RP Wanted Connection: Miles Morales
Requested by: Peter Parker

Telephone networks have failed, the internet is gone.  Modern communication seems to have come to an end.  What remains is radiowaves.  People with the right equipment have begun to communicate with anyone in range using CB radios, walkie talkies, whatever they can get their hands on.  Some are broadcasting, some are just listening.

As he tuned the radio through the various channels, looking for news, Miles heard the end of a series of coordinates.  As the static cleared, a familiar voice sounded, a voice he had not heard in over a year –

This is Peter Parker broadcasting for Miles Morales. I know you are a survivor so you are out there somewhere. This is no city, but its got video games, good people, strong walls and plenty to eat. Also hot showers are a thing here so yeah try to find your way here kid. Us spiders need to stick together.

Marvel Zombies RP is a Marvel Comics AU roleplay established 1 April 2017. We look forward to surviving with you.

Home || Plot || Rules || Taken/Open Characters || FAQ || Most Wanted

summary: lets do this one last time
title: lets do this one last time
body:
spiderman into the spiderverse came out in the tailend of 2018 - after spiderman ps4, infinity war, venom and the year after the third live-action spiderman reboot in 15 years. we’ve had a lot of spiderman. a lot.

and the creators of spiderman into the spiderverse know this, and they let us know that they knows this, not only that, they as good as apologise for it.

whenever they introduce a new spider-character, they always introduce them with this line: let’s do this one last time. pretty much everytime a character says this, it’s a little apologetic, it’s written a little tongue-in-cheek, they’re saying ‘yeah, you’ve heard it, we know that, here it is again’

these introductions are important, 'of course they are, they’re character introductions’ i hear you say, but i think they go a little beyond that. they’re something of a motif for established spider-characters

we’re first shown the introduction with RIPeter, it’s the first scene of the movie, it sticks that type of scene with spiderman, the introduction of Peter B reinforces it

for RIPeter and Peter B, we know their story, we’re tired of hearing it, they’re tired of telling it, but so are the others. gwen, ham, noir, peni - we don’t know their story, but they still tell it in the same highlight-reel speedy fashion the Peters did, because they’re so used to telling it, remember, they’re the 'one and only spiderman’ of their universe.

alongside that, the introductions are fast, a couple lines of voice-over, the important scenes of their life don’t even get a full frame, it’s snappy, detail-filled and funny, we’re not bored, we’re still interested. even though we’ve been told the story before.

the last introduction is miles’, he tells it in the same way the others do, but the difference is, instead of it all being a recap of what just happen, it’s masterfully brought back and used as an epilogue for miles’ origin story. alongside this, it’s miles fully embracing himself as spiderman, we know that this type of character introduction is used by established spider-characters, we conclude miles’ story with his introduction.

tags: spider man: into the spider verse
summary: You know those stories where teen heroes from other universes end up in the MCU?
body:
You know those stories where teen heroes from other universes end up in the MCU?

Well what if instead of ending up in front of the Avengers, they end up in front of MCU Spider-Man and he’s doing something particularly weird, but in character for Spider-Man?

Peter: *standing in a dumpster, holding a broken printer*

Miles:

Peni:

Gwen: So all versions of Peter Parker are giant messes? Good to know.

body:
color series: red

—no warnings, just fluff.

loving peter parker is red. it’s the blush on his cheeks when you brush hands, even though you’ve been together for a while now. red is the blanket he brings on your picnic date, the same one may and ben used all those years ago. he spills lemonade on it, and you tell him may won’t be mad. red is the color of the pile of hard candies you receive on valentine’s day. ned teased him, saying he should buy $20 worth of candy grams, and he did. when you receive them, you also turn a shade of red when you quickly grab them and shove them in your locker. ned had to help peter write them all. his hand had a cramp. it’s the color of the wrinkled pile of high tech uniform discarded on the floor, because sweatpants are more comfortable. the suit that you know would be so dangerous if the most wholesome boy in the world wasn’t wearing it. the boy who asks “can i hold your hand?” the boy who asks you “are you okay?” the boy who cares, so passionately, that it is red.

tags: I just need more Scott and Peter interacting with everyone tbh
unless Foehammer works the same way.
summary:
I really wanted to see Peter pick up Mjolnir and hand it back to Thor like “Here you go, Mr. Thor” and walk off. 
Because, as we...
body:
I really wanted to see Peter pick up Mjolnir and hand it back to Thor like “Here you go, Mr. Thor” and walk off.

Because, as we know, he usually has no idea what’s going on. He just goes where Mr. Stark tells him to. And he’s precious, ok? Remember the airport scene? It would be awesome.

I would also accept Scott Lang picking up Mjolnir.

blog.name: thecrossroads
blog.title: Eddie
blog.description: Some people call me the space cowboy, some call me the gangster of love

summary:
Jon Watts discussing Peter Parker’s character arc. 
Applies to all of us, don’t you think?
